sentence.Network_en: He suspects there's a conspiracy to cover up the crime.
sentence.Network_cn: 他怀疑有人密谋掩盖犯罪事实。

sentence.Network_en: The President was implicated in the cover-up and forced to resign.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统因与这起真相隐瞒事件有牵连而被迫辞职。

sentence.Network_en: His behaviour is an attempt to cover up his insecurities.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的行为是想掩饰自己的不自信。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 另外，在博客网上，再益依布拉欣直呼政府成立皇家委员会以及验尸庭来调查赵明福案件是一个“将丑事掩盖起来（cover-ups）的伎俩”。

list.abs: 大学英语四级常用词组 ... in the course of 在…期间，在…过程中 cover up 掩盖，掩饰 on credit 赊(购).

entry.def: A cover-up is an attempt to hide a crime or mistake.

example.ex: General Schwarzkopf denied there'd been any cover-up.
example.tran: 施瓦茨科普夫将军否认曾经有任何掩饰行为。

means.word_mean: 1. concealment that attempts to prevent something scandalous from becoming public

auth_sentence.content: It described the court order as a cover up.
auth_sentence.res_content: It described the court order as a cover up.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It described the court order as a cover up.

auth_sentence.content: He also accused them of engaging in a cover-up.
auth_sentence.res_content: He also accused them of engaging in a cover-up.

auth_sentence.content: He is the person chosen to cover up corruption.
